extracted_information: The WEB CONTENT primarily details advanced template features for Google Docs through the 'Document Studio' add-on, focusing on conditional content. It describes how to create dynamic documents where sections are displayed or hidden based on specified criteria, often derived from external data sources like Google Forms or Google Sheets. The content's copyright indicates relevance for 2025, but it describes current features of the add-on rather than future developments.

syntax_rules: Condition must be enclosed in parentheses.
Expressions must begin with '<<' and end with '>>'.

features.name: Conditional Sections in Google Docs Templates
features.description: Allows defining paragraphs, tables, images, and other text sections as conditional content. These sections appear only when specified criteria are met.

features.name: Conditional Formatting
features.description: Enables applying conditional formatting to generated documents (e.g., adding background color to text based on conditions).

features.name: Data Integration for Conditions
features.description: Uses data from Google Forms (e.g., 'Age', 'Country') to evaluate conditions for displaying or hiding content. Implicitly integrates with Google Sheets for data.

temporal_info.content_status: Describes current features of the Document Studio add-on, not future or roadmap features specific to 2025.
